website_summaries.verdict: The PowerShot S95 is an excellent compact camera that will complement any photographer's arsenal, provided you don't need super-fast performance specs.
pros: Compact form factor with manual control
Control ring gives a dSLR-like shooting experience
Excellent image quality for a camera of this class
cons: Pop-up flash can be obstructed by fingers

customer_reviews.title: Above my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this experience! It was the first time I purchased the used camera and worried a lot about the final outcome of this decision. I really love this particular camera but could not afford paying 450$ for the newer model. The camera arrived in tge original box, with ll additional cabels and pre-charged battery, flawless, scratchless, probably it was barely used.! Made in Japan! I am very happy with my purchase and highly recommend this carrier!
customer_reviews.author: Marishka

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera in December of 2011 and I'm still using it today! I bring this camera for all my vacations, special occasions, random outdoors activities, and consistently use it to take pictures of my eBay items. After all these years, it is still a great little camera! It's light, convenient to carry, and takes great pictures. Over the years, I've used my camera phone more often just because I always have my phone. But the phone pictures quality pales in comparison to the Canon S95. I've actually forgotten just how good this camera is! Anyway, at the time of purchase, I paid around $230. One of the best investments ever.
customer_reviews.author: SP29

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera and seller!!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned an S95 before and as a result of upcoming travel decided to buy one again because of its excellent photo quality , size and raw capture. I was not disappointed . The camera was shipped in condition that was actually better than described and super fast. I was very impressed with this seller and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tandy J. Howard

customer_reviews.title: The best point and shoot out there.
customer_reviews.text: At least when I bought it it was. I know that for a fact because I actually had many of the other ones before returning them. this one takes the best photos by far. they are crystal clear and they have quality comparable to a DSLR. I traveled all over Europe with this and it handled the trip like a pro. Don't get sucked in by the other cameras with their "400X ZOOM!!!" Generally, it's just digital zoom which is the same as taking the picture and zooming in on it in paint. Plus, after a certain zoom, the picture distorts slightly. This one is made for function, not just to attract window shoppers.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Bruckner

customer_reviews.title: Survived a massive explosion
customer_reviews.text: I was shooting video with this camera from a large tripod and there was an industrial accident followed by an large explosion. The camera was struck head-on with flying debris from the explosion. The debris was about a 30-40 pound item that became a flying projectile from several hundred feet away. The camera initially gave me the classic 'lens error.' When I got it home and attached it via HDMI to my TV, it powered down and has worked fine since then. I have to say, I truly didn't expect a camera like this to survive that kind of abuse. Didn't even scratch it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt R

customer_reviews.title: I miss this amazing model.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS camera. I have owned the S100 but love this older model so much more. Canon needs to stop trying to "improve" this model and just make it again. It is obvious that anyone who has had the S95 would want to buy it again. Sadly, I had two S95 stolen. I still have the S100 but wish I could trade it for a S95! I took over 25,000 pictures with this little camera and many times, friends believe the results were from my D7000. Nikon. Bring it back! If you want more technical pros, just ready all the great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: FranciscoTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. The S95 is my new everyday walking-around camera, replacing my Canon G10 (and very briefly a Nikon P7000). The S95 produces images of wonderful quality with good noise control (for a 1/1.7 sensor camera) all the way to ISO 2000. Operation of the menus and controls is very fast with little to no delay in selecting menu options. The customizable front control ring allows you to quickly change frequently used settings. Battery life could be better, but I'm getting a little more than the advertised 200 shots per charge, and the battery is small and light enough that it's easy to carry a couple of spares.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Great for low light
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera. Love the ability to take indoor shots without the flash. This is why I bought the camera and it is GREAT for that. Love the control ring and wealth of manual controls. Image quality is good. Biggest negative is that it is hard to hold - no natural place to put your hand. It's easy to leave my finger on top of the flash and block it from coming up. Control ring on the back does still move a little too easily since it tends to be under my thumb when holding the camera. And flash pictures are not the greatest. But I can live with the problems to get the low light capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Wsmacl

customer_reviews.title: Low-light specialty
customer_reviews.text: This is not a DSLR replacement, but it comes prettty damn close. When I don't feel like lugging my "big" camera and glass to an event, I bring this camera along. Who am I kidding, I actually prefer bringing it along to all my events. The automatic settings are actually pretty great. Ultimately, low-light photography is where this little sucker shines. I rarely use a flash and when I do, the pictures look great. No more blurry compact camera pics. The quality is amazing and all within a tiny little frame. One last thing, the zoom is fantastic. Even the digital zoom feature is relatively clear and sharp. Buy this camera, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot out there
customer_reviews.text: This is my first P&S camera. I have Nikon DSLRs and decided to get a smaller camera for days when I don't want to take the Nikons with me. I've played w/ a few different P&S cameras and this one is by far the best. Picture quality is amazing, and the different options are great. This is definitely not a camera for anyone who just uses the auto mode. If you're that person, don't waste your money, get something that costs half as much. But if you like to have control of your settings, this camera is by far the best one out there.
customer_reviews.author: sabst79

customer_reviews.title: great photos, compact size
customer_reviews.text: Lots of great features and it takes great shots. I bought this camera to bring in lieu of my SLR for instances when I didn't want to lug around the SLR or risk damaging it (like multi-pitch rock climbing routes). This camera has made me very happy. It can hang off my harness or daypack and be used single-handedly. It takes great pictures. I love the manual features. The multi-shot timer mode leads to fun summit photos. My only complaint is that the shutter speed is so slow compared to my Nikon SLR
customer_reviews.author: R.Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Love the features
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera mostly for fun as I'm mainly a dslr Canon photographer. This camera has many wonderful manual features and easy to carry around when I don't have my heavy dsrl gear. Low lighting shots are very good. Love the various "scenes" - tons of fun and creative capability. Basically I love the size and the features. There's always room for improvement on image quality, but then I'm comparing it to a dslr with a much better sensor. Two downsides: 1. Macro capability is not good. 2. On telephoto I see lots of "digital noise".
customer_reviews.author: SherryS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera for a person who loves to take great ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for a person who loves to take great photographs but who does not have aspirations of becoming a photographer and learning the logistics. I bought this camera in 2012 and was amazed by the quality of the photos it took. I dropped it on the sidewalk, alas, and so it had focus issues after that. I know how to work with it to focus it properly but if I ask anyone else to take photos on it, the photo are blurry. That said, I bought another camera and have not been happy with it. The quality of the photos does not compare. I am considering buying this one again!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lowell Mason

customer_reviews.title: excellent low light (and day light) pictures!
customer_reviews.text: I just took this camera on a recent trip. Pictures are great and I never had to use a flash (even at night). If you can see something with your eyes, this camera can take a great picture (without flash). The pictures are simply stunning! Great manual modes, and the adjustment ring in front is very useful. I have a Canon SD 1000 (not bad for bright light), but obviously the Canon S95 blows it away! I wanted something that could take good pictures (especially low light, for indoor and after sunset pictures), but did not want to carry a bulky D-SLR when I travel - the S95 perfectly fits the bill - worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.author: mhrj

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: The best point and shoot camera, period. I still use it and it takes fantastic pictures. If and when it comes time to upgrade, I'll be going to the S110 or S120. I know people love their camera phone pictures, but this one just takes beautiful pictures, plus the manual controls make things easy to manipulate based on the conditions you are in at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Zzzzz

customer_reviews.title: Canon S95 - Great pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I have many (too many) digital cameras, but none that I could take with me all the time, until now. Just returned from 2-week European trip and have found that most of my S95 pictures are better than those from my bigger and more expensive camera (which I have loved for over a year). I finally only used the bigger camera (with big zoom) when I needed the telephoto. The S95 is a great size, comfortable to use and easy to learn. The images (using mostly P) are clear, bright, colorful, stable. The night scenes amaze me! Glad I got it! Amazon service was fine, and delivery timely.
customer_reviews.author: Christie B.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Mutha
customer_reviews.text: Moved to Seoul ROK for my job, beautiful city, but it was hard to get good photos at night with a compact camera. Spent a month researching online and found that the Canon S95 appeared to be at the top of the food chain. It has not disappointed. Would buy again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to friends and family. Can not stress enough, if your looking for a great compact, this is it. And at this price...they wanted $600 for it at a Canon store downtown and I wouldn't have felt ripped off if I had paid it. *bonus* I really like the kind of gunmetal feel of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this model is 'old' news and has already been replaced by the S100. Nevertheless, I still use it often at work for jobsite photographs. In addition, we also film videos for our blog with this camera, and I am always amazed at the great quality of images. While it would have been even better if it had a mic input, you can't have everything. While I plan to upgrade eventually, I will keep using this PowerShot until it dies. If you take lots of pics or make frequent videos, do yourself a favor and buy an extra battery. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: CVAN BUILDERS

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera
customer_reviews.text: I already own a DSLR and this pocket camera is a perfect companion for times when I don't want to lug around a SLR. Gives u all the options that you are used to with the DSLR for shooting just the way you want. The display also makes it worthwhile, giving you a good resolution of the shot you just took. F2.0 is a plus. The ring up front to change the options is pretty neat. The only con is u need to get used to the camera, read the manual! other wise you will feel lost in the various options.
customer_reviews.author: The JAKAL

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means a photo buff, so I can only review this as someone who wanted a great point and shoot I could take anywhere. I have used this camera for a few years and really love it. There are so many great features and the video isn't too bad too. It is relatively small and I can take it everywhere. The picture quality is wonderful and I especially like the low-light settings. I would recommend this for anyone who wants to take professional looking photos without paying a hefty price or having too much experience!
customer_reviews.author: liv

customer_reviews.title: Nice little partner
customer_reviews.text: Perfect companion (and at times perfect replacement) to my Nikon D80. I was able to grab this camera for $369. which is a fair price. At $399.00 it's a tad bit overpriced, but a solid performer! Pros: Nice quality picture Good low light shots Compact size is great Solid construction/feel Cons: A tad bit overpriced (Like every complaint) The flash is in the way, but you do get used to it. Battery life could be better. Plan safe, purchase a backup battery. I haven't played with the video much at this time.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyD

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pictures, but............
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine little camera that takes beautiful pictures and has a really good looking display. Unfortunately, I had to send it back because, for a person like myself with very large hands, it is an ergonomic nightmare. My left forefinger was always in the way of the pop up flash and I had to be very careful of how I held it when taking pictures. For a person with small hands it is good; for me, not good. Fast lens and good sized sensor. Canon's larger point and shoots should have fast lenses like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Geo. G.

customer_reviews.title: The camera is the bomb.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the S90 for about 6 months now and loved it so much that I bought the S95 too. If you are looking for a compact camera that takes awesome pictures, this is the one. I've owned Sony's to Nikon's and I can tell you that without a doubt, this is the best point and shoot I've ever owned. The photo quality is sharp, the interface is easy to use, and I especially find the low light shots exceptional compared to any other point and shoot. It's not a DSLR, but if you have to have a backup that'll fit in your pocket, this one is the one to have.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD for my daughter and she's crazy about it. She did a lot of research beforehand and this was all she expected plus more. Instead of buying the Bundle package I individually ordered the items to go with it. I found that shopping Amazon it was about the same price as the Bundle and I received much more and higher quality items. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Makofski

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price even when not on super sale.
customer_reviews.text: I was one of lucky ones who got this at the 239 price. However even at the regular or 299 price point this is an excellent camera. I know other people who own this and have seen the results first hand. Much better low light performance than your typical point and shoot(larger sensor,faster lens) and in good light this camera is capable of excellent 16x20 inch posters. Ive seen many prints that size from it. If you have high standards for image quality this camera will deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Keith. A truth teller

customer_reviews.title: This takes pictures almost as good - sometimes better- than the dSLR/mirrorless cameras I own
customer_reviews.text: This takes pictures almost as good - sometimes better- than the dSLR/mirrorless cameras I own. Know thy tools and choose the right one for the need.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie N

customer_reviews.title: Great of course
customer_reviews.text: Does the S95 need more reviews? Excellent small camera, fast lens albeit a little limited in optical zoom; smart logic and great image quality. It is not a $3k SLR, but neither does it weigh 5 lbs. Perfect for throwing in the pocket to have everywhere, yet good enough for documentary video and photography. We have used these for shooting HD video on trans-Pacific research project and the cameras held up well and provided quality results. The S95 will remain a little workhorse of our travel kits for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: PR from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a very nice high-end point and shoot. It has many features and allows you to change things manually which is something I love to do. I know it is just a p and s but I still wish the zoom was better. Also while recording video, once you start the only zooming will be digital. Overall the price was a little high, and zooming was sub-par but the quality and customization more than made up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stands the test of time
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been in the camera market since I got this a few years ago, and I think that speaks to the quality of the S95, and what I perceive to be diminishing returns in the field of digital cameras. Other than the occasionally surprising pop up flash, sometimes questionable auto settings in medium light conditions, and inherent limitations of a sensor this size, there's really not much to improve on.
customer_reviews.author: RampagingRook

customer_reviews.title: One of the best compact cameras I've used
customer_reviews.text: At the risk of repeating what others have said, here are my top 3 favorite things about this camera: 1. It is small. It fits in my shirt pocket, and I can take it anywhere I go. 2. It gives you full manual control over the capture process - in the most intuitive and convenient manner possible. 3. Its image quality is about the best I've seen with compacts. This is Canon at its best. Happy Clicking!
customer_reviews.author: Ammy_Evaluator

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I read about this camera on a photography review website, consulted the Amazon reviews, and bought it. I bought a case for it so that when I carry it in my purse, it won't get damaged. I love how light it is. I've been known to stick it in my jeans pocket and carry it around with me. The lens isn't as fast as a SLR, though, and I've missed some shots of my fast-moving grandkids because of it. Over all, I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RPaxman

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I have a dslr as well, but I always seem to use his camera. It's particularly great in low light situations and very user friendly. I also have the underwater case, which is perfect for vacation. I have since recommended this camera to family and friends and would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the picture quality, flash compartment has failed twice.
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes amazing pictures. Very good low-light pictures. In fact, in low light situations I can see much better in the viewfinder than with the naked eye. I have used this camera on numerous trips and it's taken some of the best pictures of my friends and family. The flash compartment is the only disappointment. It has failed twice and I had to send it back to Canon to have fixed. Also when you hand your camera to someone to take a picture of you, the fact that the flash pops up is a constant surprise and tends to startle some folks, resulting in poor pictures.
customer_reviews.author: ScroogyDoo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pocket camera for the experienced photographer
customer_reviews.text: I have Nikon and Pentax DLSRs, so I was looking for a camera that would allow me to have some of the same features, but still have an auto mode for quick shots. This is the camera! I like that the camera's texture makes it easy to hold, but also easy to pocket. There is not rubber or other material to catch on fabric. Glides in/out easily, but has a good grip. To quickly come up to speed on the camera's functionality, check out Alexander White's excellent S95 book.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: worked fine. So bought three more batteries
customer_reviews.text: Had the "Change the battery pack" error. After using freshly charged batteries, worked fine. So bought three more batteries. One from Canon. Two cheaper ones from Ultraproc. All worked fine. Love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Beautiful Clouds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, even 2 years after purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera 2 years ago and it still taking great photos, the colors a great and night shooting can give you excellent results if you adjust the flash to the right level. This is the great advantage of this camera, you can adjust pretty much everything, speed, flash, ISO & much more. But if you just want to take photos the easy way there is plenty of scene modes that will give you great images.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Prada

customer_reviews.title: usa version all gone already, only euro model left?
customer_reviews.text: Like the other recent reviewer, we got the "euro" version with long corded charger CB-2LYE (vs USA CB-2LY flip-out plug) ... someone removed the seal and opened the box to throw in the USA-style cord. So we had to buy it separately for $13, as the corded model is really inconvenient for travel. Otherwise, it seems like a great upgrade over our old SD450. I guess none of this matters since S95 is about to be unavailable.
customer_reviews.author: jrm

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a canon 230HS but I was not satisfied with the IQ at low lights. Then I bought the S95, with the understanding that I am sacrificing optical zoom (3.8x for S95 vs 10+x for 230HS) for the IQ. Let me tell you this, I don't regret the decision at all. The low light and very low light images are EXCEPTIONAL. Pretty pleased. The only concern I have, about the camera in general, is that I believe the flash will have issues in the future (same comment about 230HS). I believe the reason for my worry is the design of the flash in the camera. Other than that, I am extremely pleased with S95.
customer_reviews.author: aash73

customer_reviews.title: THE ONLY CAMERA YOU NEED
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic camera, everything you need in one little lightweight body. It's fast, sharp, and has automatic, semi-automatic and manual modes. As a professional photographer I've owned everything from Leicas and Nikons to 4x5 and 8x10 Deardorffs. Unless you have special requirements, such as shooting wide-angle vistas, this camera is perfect. The only camera you need.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera- it took amazing pictures for me and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera- it took amazing pictures for me and very comfortable to carry with. but i lost during one of my trips. thinking of getting a new one. even though i have big canon one which takes more professional photos, it is not always appropriate t carry with-so this one is perfect one to have
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: very compact but very very powerful camera. I bought for underwater photography but ended using for everything. You can adjust it for every kind of light, scene or whatever you want to take adjusting (or not) everything you want. Recommend for any photographer kind, professionals that want a light but powerful camera to play with and begginers who are willing to take good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: ronaldo schwarz art

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: To the point: great compact digital camera, has many of the functions of a dslr. pictures come out great in customized "P" mode, if you are an advanced user. If handing it off briefly to a family member/friend to use, it's pretty much goof proof if you switch it to "auto" mode. The flash is the most powerful I have seen in a compact digital camera. Most functions are very intuitive, especially if you have previously used canon cameras before. Get it before the holidays to take memorable pics!
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyCA

customer_reviews.title: A fine camera for its size
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Nikon D90 DSLR with this, after tiring of the weight and bulk of that camera and the 18-200 lens I usually used. This one is very portable and takes fine pictures, but the pictures are just not the same as the ones that the DSLR took (imagine that ...). The difference became especially noticeable once I got a Retina MacBook Pro. I'll keep this as a highly portable backup camera for now, and soon I'll buy another, lighter DSLR for my main travel shooting.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Mcnerney

customer_reviews.title: Canon S95
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a point and shoot for Hawaii as I had sold mine years ago and didn't want to lug my XT around everywhere. I felt this camera had good overall shooting qualities. I was able to take pictures in small spaces like a submarine. It gave me wide enough lens for this. I am of course annoyed with the way you can't shoot photos in a rapid sequence. you have to wait for it, but other than that I am happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGirl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Nikon D40 for a few years now and wanted to buy a point and shoot that was as close to DSLR quality as possible. I looked at the Nikon P7000 and the Canon G12 first. The Nikon has had a lot of complaints and I finally decided against it. I almost went with the G12 but then found out that the S95 is virtually the same camera, just without the physical manual controls. I couldn't be happier with the choice I made. Image quality surpasses my D40. Low-light performance is fantastic. Startup time and menus are very fast. Total Win!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pozar

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to camera. I have the Canon Rebel that shoots video, but this is the camera that I reach for time after time. The reason is that it is so compact and takes such wonderful pictures. This is the one camera that others who have shot pictures with it always ask if they can borrow. I tell them they can't because I don't want to part with it for even a short time. I would definitely recommend this camera. The only thing I would suggest is for Canon to add a GPS function. Otherwise this camera is picture perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Fulmer

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera after rave reviews from both of our daughter-in-laws. We had a Canon Powershot SD1400IS, but it wasn't fast enough to capture the grandkids without blurring. We are very happy with the S95--nice wide angle lens, great color & speed. We'll have to get used to holding it differently, as we too have blocked the pop up flash from working. Overall--love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: unbeliveable clarity!  Almost as good as my canon xsi rebel
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a compact camera to carry around as my Canon Rebel EOS is too big. I tried a bunch of different Canon compacts before I purchased the S95. Honestly, I didn't want to pay so much for a compact, but once I got my hands on it, I was amazed. I have taken some fantastic macro shots of flowers with this camera. It's amazing. Still working on figuring out all the various features.. really worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: virtualspirit

customer_reviews.title: Better than the S100
customer_reviews.text: I had the Canon S95 prior to buying my S100. I loved the S95 and sold it right after getting the S100, figuring the S100 would be a superior camera. I think the photo quality is slightly better with the S95. The S100 photo quality is still excellent, and has some some features that I'd use once in a rare while, like high framerate photography. I thought the GPS would be useful for geotagging photos when I upload them to facebook, but I can rarely get a GPS signal, and when I have the GPS on the battery drains really fast. If you can pick up a S95 for $100+ cheaper than the S100, I encourage you to do so.
customer_reviews.author: roser

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pictures
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews. I am writing this one because this camera produces most amazing images and I felt I had to let other people know how great is this camera. The image quality under some situations comes close to my Nikon D300 camera that costs including lens about $3,000. It allows you great degree of manual adjustments, and most importantly the picture resolution is just unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: It's either very easy to use if you just don't bother with the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's either very easy to use if you just don't bother with the settings and are OK with standard quality photos, which I am. However, if you really want to take full advantage of what the camera has to offer, the settings are way too complicated. Some times it gets into weird modes and it's so annoying!
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: Almost As Good As An SLR......
customer_reviews.text: No need to repeat the obvious improvements over the Canon S90 that have already been discussed. This is a very nice small camera, certainly among the best available. Probably the best. It is not an SLR, but comes very close, and is great to have with you when you can't carry the big stuff and lenses and all the assessories. I am very happy to have bought this, even though I already have an S90.
customer_reviews.author: Toolman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: In the 3 years that I've owned this camera it has always produced excellent photos. Postcard quality! Sharp! If this camera were a knife it'd cut high-carbon steel like butter. And it's very easy to operate. A true Phd camera. [push here dummy]. Just set it to the defaults when you first get it and everything you shoot will be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Rosch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: It is almost 2014 and I still use this Canon PowerShot S95, which takes amazing photos - such that I have displayed in NY and NJ galleries. Some of the customers who have bought my prints can't get over the fact that the photos I took are with a pocket camera. I LOVE this little camera - what a terrific product Canon has made!
customer_reviews.author: MadForMystery

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research I decided on this camera over the new G12. Mostly because I wanted something for my pocket that I could easily take anyplace I went. It's already paid off in this way too many times to count, including stashing in my ski pants when I went sledding over the holiday weekend. In addition, the ability to shoot RAW in this size of device was important and I am impressed with the technology. Way to go Canon! I am satisfied with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Easlifer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for its size and price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I bought it refurbished, and it was like new. Has all the manual controls and a few very nice features. Fits into my pocket, yet takes great pictures. Looks like it's especially famous for the low-light pictures it takes. I also like the fact that it can be set to snap a picture when the subject smiles :) I am yet to find any significant flaws to its design. MBA
customer_reviews.author: MattA

customer_reviews.title: Three years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: This will be nearly three years I've had this camera, and it's still going strong. It is more versatile and better quality than my cell phone camera. It easily fits in a pocket.It's been dropped once or twice and continues to work, it's got a good battery life, a good flash, and good sensor. If the newer model is anything like this, it's a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great camera though battery life is kinda short
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great camera. I bought mine a year ago and it has worked just fine though i have only used it for like 2 weeks...i will be upgrading to a mirrorless camera. If anyone is interesting in buying a just like new S95, just contact me. I am including an extra battery, 8Gig memory SD card, a Canon leather cover case in addition to the battery charger and usb cable that comes with it. I also have a book on this camera that shows tips and tricks on how to use the camera..much better than the manual that comes with it. All of this for $260. Just let me know if you're interested. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I routinely take this camera everywhere I go for the wonderful low light pictures that it takes. I tell people it adds light to the picture and they somewhat agree. The flash doesn't seem to work very well, but the low light ability makes using a flash unnecessary most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Canon s95
customer_reviews.text: This camera produces great shots in low light and is outstanding in macro function. Manual features will take some time to learn but it is great to be able to manual focus in super dark areas. No view finder is a negative but the reliable focus makes up for it. The pop up flash is also in an area I usually hold a camera. It is not as good as a single lens reflex but is a great walk around camera.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dcloux

customer_reviews.title: My other  SLR camera  kind off
customer_reviews.text: Seen a picture of New York City at night taken on a private jet from the cockpit that what sold me to this camera the pic sharp clear clean I have not figure all the non-auto op. And/or auto op. But the camera has not fail me love love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I compared the S95 with several other cameras in terms of features and prices before I bought the S95. I am quite satisfied with my selection. Previously, I owned a Rebel XTi and was very happy with it. The S95 is much more portable. The main drawback is the lack of an optical view finder, but, I understand this is a necessary trade-off for portability. So, I can't blame it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay J. Yuan

customer_reviews.title: great point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I have used this camera on many trips. The picture quality is awesome, especially in low light situation. I bought this camera when it was still relatively cheap like $280. I cant believe the price has gone up by so much. The battery last a long long time. The video I took has very clear audio and very sharp video as long as one doesnt zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good image quality
customer_reviews.text: For such a small camera, it produces very good quality images. It also supports shooting in RAW, which is great since that allows for adjust things like the white balance, exposure, recovering highlights, etc. I bought it for my wife a year ago, and she's been very happy with it. Previously, I had a Canon G7 that we used (I now use a Canon 60D almost all the time).
customer_reviews.author: Buck Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera! It takes low light shots that are extremely good, even in auto-mode where you might not expect it. It is great for the tourist, as it fits in a pants pocket without being too bulky. I cannot complain about anything, and I see that the price is starting to come down ($30 less than when I bought it 2 months ago), so I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MRE

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars all the WAY!
customer_reviews.text: After using Canon A series this is the best camera you can by! I researched what all the Canon series meant and watched several videos on YouTube about this camera. After learning just a little how to use it...I have great, perfect photos even better than my daughter's Nikon expensive camera. GREAT for taking Ebay or photos to sell online. I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: 100 Wishes

customer_reviews.title: Flash malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of ordering this model although I had read about the flash problems on the Internet. When the unit is turned on, the flash pops up and it gives an error message: "Wrong flash position. Restart the camera" and the flash does not function anymore. I can still take photos without flash. If I pop down the flash and try to turn it on using the dial on the back, it gives the same error message. FOr me it is useless now. I do not live in the USA and getting is serviced is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Right for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect for my needs, and experienced photog who wants more control over the image than most Powershots offer. It is probably overkill for someone who is not interested in the flexibility that it provides, but as a mini unit to substitute for my 5d MII, it will do just fine. That said, of course it does not deliver images anywhere near to the 5D, but it will fit in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: Its a Canon!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, takes great pictures, can be set to auto for the photographer challenged. I have an SLR and also another full frame compact but everytime I travel, I reach for this one because its so compact and rides well in the trouser pocket. After a year's use, I decided to buy the waterproof casing and use it for scuba diving pictures.
customer_reviews.author: E Soon

customer_reviews.title: Does its job very well for specific purposes
customer_reviews.text: Great for personal, epic shots of people with/without scenery. The lens makes the pic soft so it's great for family gatherings, etc. Something to keep in your pocket for quick candid shots. For me, it's a niche camera, and it does what I described above as its niche very well. Can't think of any reason to give it a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Morph

customer_reviews.title: Impressive pocketable camera!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the camera!Great low light pics. Wanted very high end pocketable camera with manual controls. Found very favorable professional reviews for both the Canon S95 and the Panasonic LX5. Noted that while the LX5 had a wider lens (24mm), a larger battery, and more control over video shoting,it was larger than the Cannon S95 and didn't review well for auto mode operation. Only recommendation for potential buyers: get a spare battery and seriously consider a fast SD card (e.g. Class 10). Camera can process pics and video very quickly but can be hindered by a slow card.
customer_reviews.author: DanB

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: We have had it since Nov 2011. The auto mode works ok. We used it at first but we seemed to be getting a lot of blurry pictures or pictures that were too dark. We switched to the P mode and have made some adjustments to get the quality of pictures that we prefer. We also did some research to understand how to adjust the ISO. It has been a learning experience but overall we like this camera.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Great little powerhouse. The flash is in the wrong place because i always want to hold the camera there but i'll get used to it. the mic picks up wind noise but i guess that's a common problem. All in all it's a joy to use. If you are looking for something to use in Auto all the time don't waste your money. If you like experimenting at least in P mode ... go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a true gem, the video and photo capability are truly impressive. The RAW capability, and surprising amount of controls for both video and photos are really fantastic. Being able to control the exposure for video, and being able to control the f power of the flash is truly great! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro in MSP

customer_reviews.title: This is the professional point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Coming from DSLR, I have to say the picture quality is just as good. The biggest plus of this camera I've found is the HDR mode. It will actually take 3 pictures of the same scene with different exposures and combine all 3 to create a very high quality vivid HDR shot, but make sure you have a tripod for this mode! I found this feature is extremely helpful with photographer like me because I used to combine them with photoshop and thats really time consuming. This camera's low light performance is also the best in its class. I have taken shots without flash and it comes out very clear and sharp with minimal noise.
customer_reviews.author: Weihao Lu

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t get what I paid for
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with USB cable, cd rom, wrist strap or av cable!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Little less than what i expected
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Point and Shoot camera with good shutter response to take pics of my kid. After reviewing lots of camera online, finally settled on S95. The photos are crisp, focus is quick on half press, but the shutter lag is a let down. Probably I was trying to find features of a DSLR in a PoS and surely failed in that. Will probably buy a D3100 soon. Quality of videos from S95 are little inferior to those from flip, so i still use flip to shoot videos mostly.
customer_reviews.author: DY

customer_reviews.title: Great pics - except with flash!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera for daylight/lowlight conditions - beautiful colors, good low-light performance, and the image stabilization is great. However, when the flash is used (in Auto mode), there is a strange bright yellow tint cast on everything! Maybe this particular camera is defective, I don't know of other similar complaints for this model. But it is a serious yellow tint - and hair highlights turn bright yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Doob In NM

customer_reviews.title: Great little point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this camera for my wife. We took it on a trip and since then I'm using it most of the time. It's auto setting works very well, but if you know how to use a slightly advanced camera then this is perfect for you. The picture quality has been fantastic, very clear and colorful. I'm not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Treyathlete

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures and low-light performance
customer_reviews.text: This camera seems to have incredible intelligence in determining exposure levels. Low light performance is outstanding, though you may have to accept substantial reduction in resolution to take pictures in exceptionally dim conditions. I'm very comfortable using it in place of my Rebel XSi SLR when I want something easy to carry in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: AJGB

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Masterpiece!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was a little skeptical about spending the big bucks to get this camera. I have always had a Canon and was willing to switch to another brand mainly because of the night shots my camera took. I had the Canon SD IS 1100 and thought of giving Canon one last try based on few recommendations from my friend. So I ended up getting the Canon S95 and my wife took this to SFO for her girls trip and all the ladies loved the pics it took. IT is really amazing and definitely worth the price. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amrit Babu

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are good, colors are also good
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive. Too little zoom. The fancy options are there, but they are not handy. I'd not buy it again. Pictures are good, colors are also good.
customer_reviews.author: Veet Vivarto

customer_reviews.title: Best camera
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best camera I have ever had. There are so many great settings to get great pictures no matter what you are shooting, but the auto setting is perfect when you just want to point and shoot as it automatically adjusts itself to the correct setting. If it senses low light, it will change to that setting; if it senses you are outside, it will change to that setting. It is by far my favorite part of the camera. But I would highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: jshelds

customer_reviews.title: Canon S95
customer_reviews.text: I have researched for about 4 months for a Point & Shoot Camera with good manual control & low-light performance, great image quality and various modes for taking pictures and no matter which camera I looked at, I kept coming back to the S95. Yes, Lumix LX5 is slightly better camera but it's not as small & probably not as easy to use. Since battery life is an issue for S95, I brought a battery from. S95's 4X zoom is the only reason you might want to buy another point & shoot, other than that it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: mashfiqur rahman

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: and i miss it dearly. I wish I never left this camera in a rental during a business trip. I took this camera everywhere with me and never had any glitchy problems with the programming or the lens. I'd gladly buy this camera in the future if the price ever goes back down.
customer_reviews.author: Internal Conquest

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact camera
customer_reviews.text: The Canon S95 is an excellent camera for general use. It is quite compact (though not quite pocket-size), especially for the features it has. Picture quality won't rival DSLR's, of course, but is very good for a compact P&S. Construction appears to be very solid, and the S95 is a pleasure to use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The Rabbi

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Best point-n-shoot I've owned yet. We bought this to replace a Panasonic Lumix waterproof camera that was of great build quality but only really took good pictures under good lighting. This Canon takes great photos pretty much wherever and is truly easy to use. I know a bit about cameras, but am too lazy or busy to get into all the various settings so I needed a good auto camera. VERY happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: klm

customer_reviews.title: Canon S95 outperforms all previous point & shoot predecessors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I needed a point and shoot camera with higher capabilities than others I have purchased before. I needed a P & S camera with digital SLR capabilities. I was really tired of coming back with almost great pictures of the event one second after the dream shot could have happened. I was not disappointed. This camera catches action photos and moving subjects quickly enough to get the shot!!! No more, hey could you folks who just scored the winning goal, would you mind getting together and faking a shot so I can actually capture it on my terribly slow point & shoot camera? Hallelujah!!!! Praise the lord. Amen.
customer_reviews.author: voooduchild

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It has served me quite well for a very long time. I dropped it once and broke the lens, but was able to have it repaired quite easily. Takes wonderful clear pictures, especially since I'm not all that steady. Great all around camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Randol

customer_reviews.title: Image quality is good enough for a pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: For a pocket camera, Canon PowerShot S95 has very good image quality, even in the darker situation. Since I got it at a very good deal (almost half price), I like it very much. The only disadvantage is the flashlight is not covenient to open. But it's no need for almost all the day time. So it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: Xiaogang Wu

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This puppy takes great pictures but like all cameras with manual settings it has a learning curve. Dont just clip off a few shotson auto and base your opinion on the results. Take lots of pictures and try every setting to become familiar with its capabilities. Its worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first sale by this merchant. The camera was only advertised as "like new", and happily it was indeed like new, with all the accessories included. It takes excellent pictures and video. A+ for this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Sealight

customer_reviews.title: Awesome P&S Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome P&S camera. It is much better than any other compact camera that I have ever used, and is great for carrying around when I don't want to lug around the DSLR. This is not your typical compact camera, it is definitely worth the price you pay! Manual controls are easy to use and adjust. One of the features that I use more than I expected is the video mode, the video that this captures is great! I bought a Canon SD1400IS and returned it the same week because the picture quality and camera speed was not good enough for my taste. Basically, you get what you pay for and this camera is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: I hike a lot, and this camera is ALMOST as good as a full on dslr in most instances. Obviously, it isn't going to handle telephoto, macro, wide angle stuff well but if you are looking for a pocket camera, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Foofienugget

customer_reviews.title: High quality small camera
customer_reviews.text: Good quality camera with a good quality f2 lens. A significant improvement over the flawed S90. My wife has a 110, and it is even a bit better. Good compromise between a high quality camera and portability.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Canon S95 only worked for 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: About 3 weeks after receiving Canon PowerShot S95, the linse went suddenly black, everything else worked, I was able to see the photos already taken etc. I was going to europe next day, and thought I would have a better look at it when I arrived there. I went to a Canon authorized shop in France and only then realized that the guarantee only covered Canada and North America. Canon in France told me that I needed a new linse, but would have to pay that myself, which would be almost half the price of the camera. It would have been nice to know prior my purchase, that the gurantee was limited.
customer_reviews.author: Ib

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I purchased this one to replace my old old camera (only 2MB picture). The results are amazing. I'm happy that I don't need to use flash for low light settings. The auto mode is fantastic for people who just started to use this camera. I'm going to try more scene modes. The screen is wide, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Betterlife

customer_reviews.title: quality problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera primarily based on reviews that gave high praise. It worked well for about 3 weeks and then the silicon image chip went dead. I mailed it back to Canon for a warranty repair, and it now works again. Aside from failing soon after purchase it appears to be a good camera.
customer_reviews.author: digitaldan

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my wife
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves her camera! Very many pros Only a couple of cons, hence the 4 star rating. 1. Rechargeable battery only - can't just run into a store and buy a couple of AA batteries if power runs low. Suggest buying an extra rechargable to have on hand and charged. 2. Flash pops up when needed and tends to interfere with properly holding the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McCabe

customer_reviews.title: We like it very much!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of a photographer, but this little guy takes nice photos. Easy to carry around; small and light. No big lenses to deal with, which is good for me. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD
product_meta.description:
One look at Canon's new PowerShot S95 will have you moving "upgrade my digital camera" to the top of your to-do list. The ultra-slim, ultra-intelligent S95 is loaded with all a serious photographer's must-haves, including a bright f/2.0 wide-angle lens and professional-style control ring for intuitive manual control. Canon's HS System is on board for spectacular performance and image quality in low light.And, new for a compact, the S95 incorporates Canon's Hybrid IS for blur-free shooting even close-up. You'll shoot stunning 720p HD video with stereo sound, then watch it immediately on your HDTV with the simple HDMI connection. If photography's your passion, now is the perfect time to step up to PowerShot S95.1-Year Canon U.S.A. Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


One look at Canon's new PowerShot S95 will have you moving "upgrade my digital camera" to the top of your to-do list. The ultra-slim, ultra-intelligent S95 is loaded with all a serious photographer's must-haves, including a bright f/2.0 wide-angle lens and professional-style control ring for intuitive manual control. Canon's HS System is on board for spectacular performance and image quality in low light. 



And, new for a compact, the S95 incorporates Canon's Hybrid IS for blur-free shooting even close-up. You'll shoot stunning 720p HD video with stereo sound, then watch it immediately on your HDTV with the simple HDMI connection. If photography's your passion, now is the perfect time to step up to PowerShot S95. 

Canon PowerShot S95 Highlights 

Canon's HS System for improved low light performance and better image quality
The PowerShot S95 employs the Canon HS System by combining a powerful 10.0-megapixel CCD sensor and Canon's DIGIC 4 Image Processor. Thanks to this technological advancement, the S95 is dramatically more sensitive than cameras with identical megapixel counts, and delivers spectacular images with minimal noise. Increased sensitivity demands a higher ISO speed, and the PowerShot S95 delivers with a new maximum setting of ISO 12,800. Blur and camera shake are notably reduced for the ultimate in sharpness and clarity. 


Shoot beautiful 720p HD video in stereo sound
The PowerShot S95 lets you record video in beautiful high definition (1280 x 720 pixels). The camera also makes it easy to enjoy HD videos (and still photos) on your HDTV with a mini-HDMI connector for direct connection to a high-definition TV monitor. You'll enjoy the HD experience with no degradation of image or audio in the signal, plus the ability to display up to 130 still images at once. 

Control ring for intuitive manual control
Focus, Exposure, ISO, Step Zoom, or White Balance can now be adjusted more precisely than ever with the S95's control ring. It's even more intuitive and quicker than the usual 2-button control and the S95 lets you decide which function the ring will adjust. 

Bright f/2.0 lens
The S95 sports an f/2.0 aperture, perfect for creating enticing portraits, by drawing attention to the face and blurring the background with its impressively shallow depth-of-field. The Macro setting lets you get even closer. The large aperture also does more. It lets you capture more nuances in low light shooting by using more of the available light. You'll be ready for anything with a lens aperture larger than even many professional sizes. 






Canon's Hybrid IS to compensate for angular and shift camera shake during close-up shooting


The PowerShot S95 is one of the first compact cameras to be equipped with Canon's highly advanced Hybrid IS function, which corrects camera shake from two sources to deliver sharp, blur-free images even when you zoom in close to your subject. 



Hybrid IS employs both an angular sensor and an accelerometer, enabling it to suppress both the blur caused by the angle of the camera and the "shift blur" that happens when your subject moves parallel to the camera, a problem that is especially noticeable at large zoom factors. 

With the ability to produce clear, steady images in most situations and at any zoom length, the PowerShot S95 is the camera you'll want to take everywhere. 

Full range of shooting and recording modes
The PowerShot S95's RAW mode lets you shoot images without JPEG compression. It gives you clearer images and complete creative control in editing. RAW images are transferred directly to the computer where they can then be edited using image adjustment software or a processing application to adjust your images as you please. The camera can also be set to allow the simultaneous recording of both RAW and JPEG images while shooting. 

Also, with 26 Shooting Modes including 18 Special Scene Modes, you're ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

3.8x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer, plus a 28mm wide-angle lens
The PowerShot S95 features Canon's precision 28mm wide-angle 3.8x optical zoom lens that allows you to shoot most scenes from wide-angle to telephoto. It lets you capture more in every frame, so everyone fits in a family gathering shot. When it's time to take a closer look, the Canon Optical Image Stabilizer helps minimize camera shake and reveal almost every detail. 




What's in the Box

 * PowerShot S95 Camera body 
 * Lithium-ion Battery Pack NB-6L 
 * Battery Charger CB-2LY 
 * Wrist Strap WS-DC9 
 * AV Cable AVC-DC400ST 
 * USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM
feature_bullets: 10.0-megapixel sensor combined with the DIGIC 4 Image Processor creates Canon's HS System
Capture 720p HD video in stereo sound; play back on an HDTV via the HDMI output
f/2.0 lens for low light conditions or shallow depth-of-field; control ring for intuitive manual control
3.8x optical zoom; 28mm wide-angle lens; Canon's Hybrid IS to compensate for angular and shift camera shake
Capture images to SD/SDHC/SDXC memory cards (not included),Made in JAPAN

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars735 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
